content: Great tool to facilitate conceptual understanding! I noticed the circuit building simulations available don't have capacitors as components available to use. In the two Circuit Construction Kits ("DC" & "DC Virtual Lab"), capacitors aren't a listed component. I know they aren't used much in DC circuits but they still are useful as they store charge. Is it possible to get the simulation titled Circuit Construction Kit (AC + DC), please? PhET is great; thank you for the mobile platform!
replyContent: We are actively working on Circuit Construction Kit AC, and plan to have a HTML5 version available in the app early in 2021! (There is a prototype version on our website)

content: Can you add more formulas in the app when i search some formulas there is no result so please can you add more formulas
replyContent: We understand your suggestion, but we are focused on conceptual learning, so we generally as a design rule do not include formulas within our simulations (some have them where appropriate). We are more interested in elucidating the cause and effect relationships that formulas embody.

replyContent: Unfortunately only HTML5 sims will run in the app. As we convert more simulations to HTML5 they will be added to the app!

content: These are fantastic! PhET has been used in my classes for Earth Science, Chemistry, and even AP Chemistry for years, but app makes this extremely accessible, especially in the virtual setting where this can be a really powerful tool. The digital tools are simple to use, students find their use to be intuitive, and the cognitive load can be spent on the science rather than figuring out the program. Thank you for all you've done to create such a great learning tool!
replyContent: Thank you so much for your thoughtful and appreciative review!

content: Amazing concept (I've been using your website for a long time and went here to check out a new app as well), but it needs a bit of polishing. If I click "Info" button in simulation selection and then go back to list, I end up at the top of list. It would have been a nice feature to be able to select simulation language from within application, since going all the way to android settings is an overkill when you just want to see single simulation in another language, which is a somewhat common task for me.
replyContent: Unfortunately, the Android development guidelines and operating system are setup to change languages in this fashion. If you know of an app that has internal language switching, please let us know so we can investigate more. We are aware of the navigation glitch and will be working on it.

content: I have used PhET Sims for many years in my Mathematics classroom with a variety of ages and am so pleased to see all the HTML5 versions and also this latest excellent version of the app. I have so many favourites! replyContent: We appreciate the thoughtful review! Some more math sims on the way soon :).

content: I have been fan PhET for a long time, and it is great to see it in app form. As a physicist I can only talk about the physics apps, but these are very good, easy to use and designed in such a way to illustrate the core underlying physics. I can see the potential of this during a time of remote teaching and learning; learners can now access a wealth of physics and develop their understanding. Well done Phet!
replyContent: Thank you so much for your thoughtful review!

content: I have taught Physics with PhET for years - their simulations make concepts clear. Now students and anyone interested can explore them in a neat app environment - the menus get you to the topic swiftly and everything works as it should. The package will capture students' imagination and they'll investigate more topics than they came for!
